alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 12:20PM EDT until April 09 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Friday was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 3.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 05/18/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Rifle River Sterling 6.0 6.5 Fri 11 am ED 5.3 4.5 4.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
